name: BENONI DEFENSE
uci_moves: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 c7c5 d4d5 e7e6 b1c3 e6d5 c4d5 d7d6
idea: The Benoni creates maximum imbalance! Black accepts a backward pawn on d6 and a hole on d5 to get a queenside pawn majority (a7, b7, c5 against a2, b2) and dynamic counterplay. Black's plan is simple: ...b5, ...Nb6-c4 or ...a6/...b5/...b4 to create a passed pawn. Meanwhile, White attacks the kingside with e4-e5 or Bf4/Bg5. It's a race between the two attacks!
errors_white: Playing passively: White has e4-d5 but must use this space to attack
Ignoring ...b5: this push creates a passed pawn, you must play a4 to prevent it
Exchanging on d6 without reason: the d6 pawn is weak, dxd6 frees it!
errors_black: Playing ...b5 without preparation: a4 can stop it, prepare with ...a6 first
Forgetting the kingside: ...h6 and ...Kh7 can be useful against the white attack
Exchanging pieces: Black needs pieces for the attack, avoid unnecessary exchanges
development: Backward pawn but essential - it controls e5 and protects the center
Mandatory fianchetto - the Bg7 attacks d5 and a1, defends the King
THE plan! ...a6 then ...b5 creates the majority and threatens ...b4
Quick kingside castle - the King must be safe before White's attack
...Ra8-b8 supports ...b5, or ...Qa5 with pressure on a2

traps.name: d5 Pawn Trap
traps.desc: After 4.Nc3, Black MUST play ...exd5! If ...d6?! first, White keeps more space. AVOID (Black): Always take ...exd5 to open the diagonal for the Bf8.

traps.name: Knight Trap
traps.desc: If Black plays ...Bg4?! too early, White has h3! Bxf3 Qxf3 with an active Queen and d6 is weak. AVOID (Black): Develop ...g6/...Bg7 first, ...Bg4 only if useful.

traps.name: Kingside Trap
traps.desc: Typical position. White prepares e5 or Bf4-e5. If Black is passive, e5! dxe5 d6! creates a devastating passed pawn. AVOID (Black): Play ...a6, ...b5 FAST to create counterplay!

variants.name: Classical Benoni
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 c7c5 d4d5 e7e6 b1c3 e6d5 c4d5 d7d6 e2e4 g7g6 g1f3 f8g7 f1e2 e8g8 e1g1 a7a6
variants.white_plan: a4 (prevents ...b5), Bf4 or Bg5, then e5 or f4 for the attack. Nd2-c4 targets d6.

variants.name: Taimanov Variation
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 c7c5 d4d5 e7e6 b1c3 e6d5 c4d5 d7d6 e2e4 g7g6 f2f4 f8g7 f1b5 f6d7 a2a4 e8g8
variants.white_plan: f4 prepares e5 and blocks the f5 square. Nf3, 0-0, then e5 with attack. a4 blocks Black's queenside.
variants.black_plan: Difficult counterplay! ...Na6, ...Nc7, ...Rb8 and look for ...b6/...b5 despite a4. ...f5 possible to block.

variants.name: Fianchetto System
variants.uci: d2d4 g8f6 c2c4 c7c5 d4d5 e7e6 b1c3 e6d5 c4d5 d7d6 g1f3 g7g6 g2g3 f8g7 f1g2 e8g8 e1g1 a7a6
variants.white_plan: Double fianchetto possible with b3/Bb2. Less aggressive but solid. Nd2, a4, Nc4 with pressure.
variants.black_plan: More space to breathe! ...Nbd7, ...Rb8, ...b5 and normal counterplay. ...Re8, ...Ne5 active.
